header.title: LIBER SITRA AHRA
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Chaos Magic, Luciferianism, Qliphoth, Grimoire Tradition

central_thesis: The central thesis of 'Liber Sitra Ahra' is to provide a comprehensive guide to 'Chao-Luciferianism', a system designed to enable the practitioner to transcend the perceived illusionary 'cosmic order' (created by the Demiurge) and return to 'Sitra Ahra' (primal chaos). This is achieved through the embrace of adversarial forces, radical self-empowerment, rejection of conventional morality, and engagement in specific ritualistic practices, including various forms of sacrifice, sigil magic, and Kabbalistic numerical manipulation, to awaken the 'black flame' within and achieve spiritual transformation.

structure_content.summary: This section outlines the historical context of the 'Sect of Angra Mainyu', founded in 2005 after a lucid dream and studies in Qliphoth Kabbalah. It describes the formation of a secret group, the creation of the 'Tome of Ahriman', and the eventual dissolution of the 'Church of Luciferian Light' due to external rejection and internal power struggles within the council in 2008. The book itself is presented as an expose of the sect's hidden teachings, published by the author after the council's opposition.

This chapter establishes the philosophical underpinnings of the system. It asserts that truth is infinite, that those who align with chaos are not betrayers, and that freedom is found outside the 'egg' of the cosmic order, in 'Sitra Ahra'. It introduces the magical significance of the number 11, the importance of squares and mathematics as a universal language. It features invocations to Lucifer and Moloch, advocating a rejection of demurgic propaganda and a pursuit of 'true will' and 'Ahriman'. Death is presented as a rebirth and liberation from the physical prison, contrasting subjective morality with an eternal, recycling energy.

This section delves into the numerical and Kabbalistic framework of the system. It introduces 'AZRAT' (Azerate) as having a numerical value of 218, summing to 11, which relates to the 11 anti-cosmic keys of the Qliphoth Tree of Death. Through 'Temura' Kabbalah, 'AZRAT' transforms into 'LPDLS' (numerical value 204, summing to 6), which further combines with 11 to yield 17. The number 17 is linked to the swastika, signifying a 'weapon in the war with heaven' and a 'crossing of two lightning bolts'. It also explores the number 358 (Nechesh/Messiah), connecting the serpent and the swastika as symbols of opposition to cosmic order and pathways to Sitra Ahra. It discusses 'Demon Kings' and their numerical values (Oriens=45, Ariton=63, Paimon=72, Amaimon=52, total 232, summing to 7), with 7 meaning 'Power Lost', interpreted as Ahriman's nine-year rule before Ahura Mazda. It also analyzes numbers 6 and 50 (from Crowley's Book of the Law) linking to 'Binah' (death) and 'Separation', ultimately reinforcing the number 11.

Serving as a practical manual for Luciferianism as taught by the Sect, this section is an updated version of previously private rituals and information from the 'Tome of Ahriman'. It carries a strong warning against casual engagement by 'weekend Satanists' or those seeking 'morbid curiosity', explicitly stating its intention for the 'Chao-Luciferian movement' and 'the elevated, and the elite'. The author disclaims responsibility for any unlawful acts performed using the book's contents.

This chapter outlines the core tenets of Luciferian identity: a 'superior breed' of predators ascending through strength, embodying the balance of Samael-Lilith. It critiques Anton LaVey's 'Satanism' as materialistic and lacking spiritual depth. The text contextualizes the 'Adversary' by tracing its manifestations across diverse mythologies—Apep (Egyptian), Set (Egyptian), Ahriman (Zoroastrian), Samael (Judaic), Shaitan (Islamic), Lucifer (Christian)—unifying them as representations of 'Chaos' and the source of 'Sitra Ahra'.

structure_content.chapter_title: A Pre-requisite to the System of Aka-Paimon
structure_content.summary: This section details the foundational knowledge required for the Aka-Paimon system, emphasizing the mastery of Kabbalah (Dogmatic, Practical, Literal, Unwritten), meditation (Asana, diaphragmatic breathing, focal points, mantras), skrying, and the importance of ritual. It provides a detailed table of Hebrew letters, their numerical values, and their inverse, Luciferian meanings, associating them with concepts like 'whore', 'demiurge's dwelling', 'flame of Ahriman', 'Satanic power', 'black hand of Set', and 'physical prison'.

This chapter describes the essential tools and sacred spaces for performing rituals. It outlines the symbolic and practical construction of 'The Chamber' (the universe/doorway between worlds), 'The Circle' (current world/universe entry), and 'Triangle' (unholy trinity). Specific ritual 'Arts' are introduced: 'The Triangle Art of Aka Paimon' (featuring a swastika, the number 218, and names of Lilith, Samael, Chiva, Lucifuge Rofocale, Beelzebuth, Moloch, Asmodeus) and 'The Unholy Trinity Art' (with Qemetial, A’athiel, Belia’al, hexagram, pentagram, 777). 'The Circle of Human Sacrifice' is described, containing names like Samael, Lilith, Kali, the number 777, and a lightning bolt/swastika.

This section provides instructions for fundamental rituals. The 'Skrying Ritual' involves meditating, burning a sigil in a metal bowl, and gazing into a black mirror while chanting a mantra. The 'Spirit Conjuration Ritual' focuses on contacting a spirit by memorizing and burning its sigil, meditating with its name, and offering blood sacrifice (animal) into a bowl, with the aim of receiving lucid dreams or visions.

structure_content.chapter_title: PART FOUR: THE RITUALS OF THE SECT OF ANGRA MAINYU
structure_content.summary: This section details several controversial and transgressive rituals. 'The Prayer to Ama Lilith' involves offerings of menstrual blood, a dead infant animal, lotus/rose petals, and bones within the 'Triangle Trinity Art'. 'Demonic Invocation' includes a small animal blood sacrifice to 'feed the bloodthirsty gods' and seek enlightenment. The 'Human Sacrifice Ritual' explicitly describes the killing of a 'baptized child' in a dark setting, offering its eyes, throat, and heart to chaos gods for enlightenment and strength. The 'Ritual of Nechesh' seeks inner enlightenment from the serpent through meditation on the swastika and the number 358. 'The Abortion Ritual' involves offering an aborted fetus to Lilith. The 'Ritual of Self Sacrifice' details a three-day process culminating in the magician's suicide, offering their blood and life to the 'wrathful ones'. 'Curses' involve creating a poppit, painting sigils, and burying the poppit in a cemetery with ritualistic prayers to 'Naheema'.

structure_content.chapter_title: PART FIVE: MORE TEACHINGS OF THE SYSTEM OF AKA PAIMON
structure_content.summary: This chapter describes sacred locations. The 'Magician’s Dwelling' is a designated, secret, cursed area (woods, graveyard, crypt) for personal study, meditation, and keeping grimoires and sacrifices, acting as an energy source and portal to Sitra Ahra, established through a 'Formation of the Dwelling Ritual' involving ground bones, animal blood, and sigil drawing. 'Sacrificial Grounds' are distinct, one-time-use locations for rituals, requiring a blood-washing of the soil and being permanently cursed.

This chapter details a child sacrifice ritual dedicated to Moloch, emphasizing the rejection of moral dilemma. It describes the setting in a forest, the use of a table with metal straps, and the drawing of Moloch's sigil and number. The ritual involves chanting prayers, marking a child with a Sigil of Sitra Ahra in goat blood and a Sigil of Lilith in menstrual blood, and ultimately setting the child on fire with oils, aiming to 'unleash another spirit' and 'harvest power and knowledge' from the 'land of shells'.

This section provides visual representations and brief descriptions of key sigils used within the system, including BOHU, TOHU, CHASEK (the three veils before Satan), ANGRA MAINYU (Ahriman), NAHEEMA (The Weaver), SEAL OF THE SECT OF ANGRA MAINYU (the sect's emblem), ABORTION (for the abortion ritual), and SITRA AHRA (the sigil for the 'other side').

Presented as a reference guide, this section lists 'FIVE ZOROASTRIAN DEMONS' (Savar, Akoman, Andar, Naikiyas, Taprev) with their descriptions and Gematria values, linking them to Ahriman. It then analyzes the numerical values of these demons, breaking them down to arrive at 32 and then 5, representing the five main demons under Ahriman. Further numerical analysis connects Satan (771), Angra Mainyu (366), and Samael (131) to the number 17 (the swastika symbol). It also lists 'MORE INTERESTING NUMBERS' related to various adversarial entities and concepts. The 'FIVE FLAMES OF AHRIMAN' (Sama Atar, Druj Nasu, Zairich and Taprev, Spenjagra, Aeshma) are introduced. A list of 'ORDERS OF QLIPHOTH' with their associated demonic entities and meanings is provided. Finally, it offers an occult interpretation of 'Little Miss Muffet', linking the spider to Naheema (The Weaver).

structure_content.chapter_title: NOTES ON THE BOOK OF THE LAW
structure_content.summary: This section presents a complex gematria analysis of the equation '4638 ABK24 ALGMOR 3Y x(24)(89) RPSTOVA 2', reportedly from Aleister Crowley's 'Book of the Law' (verse 76). The author breaks down the numbers and letters, associating them with concepts like 'secret hiding place', 'rest', 'peace', 'slave', 'servant', 'existence', 'Kether', 'vision', 'father', 'riddle', 'first born', 'messiah', 'antique serpent', 'Adam Primus', 'Naaman' (Nahema), 'plantation/garden', 'azerate', 'union of hexagram and pentagram', 'Divine will and man’s will', 'Washington D.C.', 'heavenly realm', 'woman, strength, army', 'CIA', 'demiurge', and 'Revelations 3:14'.

This chapter presents various numerical squares and associated concepts, encouraging further discovery. It includes 'THE SQUARE OF THE UNHOLY TRINITY' (numbers 3,1,4,3,9,8,2,1,7), 'SATAN, SAMAEL, ANGRA MAINYU' (numbers 7,1,6,4,7,6,1,3,1), 'The Triangle Art of Aka Paimon' (numbers 2,4,4,1,7,7,8,4,7), and 'The Lower Spheres' (numbers 2,3,1,8,4,6,4,0,5). These numerical sequences are presented alongside Hebrew words and their English translations such as 'Death' (תאד), 'Fearful Things. Serpents of the Dust' (רפעילחז), 'Sun and Moon' (חריושמש), 'War' (המחלמ), and 'Plague' (עגנ). The author stresses that these are just the 'tip of the iceberg' for understanding occult secrets hidden in numbers.

This section presents a poetic and prophetic text that reinforces the themes of cleansing, transformation, and liberation. It speaks of the 'tortures of LPDLS', an 'upcoming shift of power', and the 'collapse of an Order'. The text describes a personal transformation, becoming a 'shell' and being 'reborn'. It culminates in a vision of a 'woman' (the Weaver) who speaks of a 'cleansing of spirits', a new empire rising from the ashes of the old, and the replacement of humanity by 'serpents' who will 'open the door to Sitra Ahra'. The text suggests that 'immortality is not' unavoidable, but the cleansing is, and emphasizes the path to illumination.

The author, Aka Paimon, concludes by reflecting on the esoteric nature of the 'Grimoire of Aka Paimon', expressing regret for making certain contents public due to a council vote. He issues a final warning against 'dumbing down' the book's contents and reiterates that he and the Sect do not condone unlawful acts, emphasizing personal responsibility for any actions taken by readers.

key_concepts.definition: The 'Other Side' or 'Left Side', representing the primal chaos, the limitless, eternal, pan-dimensional chaos that exists outside and in opposition to the 'cosmic egg' or cosmic order created by the Demiurge. It is the ultimate destination for Luciferians after death, a realm of formless light and divine sparks.

In this adverse Kabbalistic system, the Qliphoth are the 10 spheres that stand in direct opposition to the Sephiroth of the Tree of Life. While the Sephiroth work towards light and order, the Qliphoth work towards darkness and chaos, embodying the absolute manifestation of evil and containing the 'darkness that flows'. They are also referred to as the 'land of shells', with each sphere ruled by a specific demon.

The collective name for the 11 anti-cosmic keys, represented by 11 Qliphothic entities or demons (Satan, Moloch, Belphegor, Lilith, Nahemma, Adramelech, Asmodeus, Astaroth, Lucifuge Rofocale, Bael, Beelzebut). These keys are believed to open the gate to Sitra Ahra and are numerically associated with the value 218.

A central adversarial deity, known in Zoroastrianism as Angra Mainyu, the destructive force and absolute antithesis to cosmic order. In this system, Ahriman is the 'dark mother of desire' and the giver of the 'black flame' to humanity. He is depicted as ruling the universe for a temporary period before being replaced by Ahura Mazda, symbolizing the 'Power Lost'.

The nom de plume of the author, John Richard Putignano, and the name of the comprehensive magical system detailed in the book. It represents the persona and teachings through which the Chao-Luciferian path is presented.

A spiritual path emphasizing constant ascension, strength, self-preservation, and the rejection of weakness, submission, and conventional morality. It seeks to emulate the 'perfect unity of balance' of Samael-Lilith and views Lucifer as the 'father of Dissidence'. Practitioners are called to master their minds, transcend the material world, and align with chaos to return to Sitra Ahra.

The creator god of the cosmic order and the physical universe, viewed as a prison that enslaves humanity through limited senses and dimensions, forbidding comprehension of true chaos and lawlessness. Referred to by names such as IHVH, Tetragrammaton, Eliom, Jehovah, and Allah.

A powerful symbolic weapon against the heavens and the cosmic order, also representing the serpent (Nechesh) in the Garden of Eden. Numerically linked to 17 (from Yi King's hexagram Sui, meaning 'follow'), 32, and 358, it symbolizes a 'divine spark' used to destroy the demiurge and a crossing of 'lightning bolts'.

The Hebrew word for the serpent that tempted Eve in the Garden of Eden, numerically valued at 358 through gematria. Interestingly, 358 is also the numerical value of 'Messiah'. In the Aka Paimon system, it is a symbol of dissidence, knowledge, and enlightenment, directly linked to the swastika.

A word derived from 'AZRAT' (Azerate) through the Kabbalistic method of 'Temura', it has a numerical value of 204 (which reduces to 6). It is intrinsically linked to the Hexagram (universe) and Binah ('A Window'). The author hints at LPDLS representing 'emptiness' and 'tortures', a key concept for discovery whose full meaning is kept secret but is presented as a puzzle for the illuminated to solve.

A symbolic inner fire or divine spark given from Ahriman to humanity. It represents true strength, immortality, and enlightenment, contrasting sharply with the 'illusionary light' of the Demiurge. It is the core essence that Luciferians seek to awaken and cultivate to return to Sitra Ahra.

A demonic entity central to child sacrifice rituals, representing the 'fires of Ahriman'. Sacrifices to Moloch are performed to transcend moral boundaries, 'feed the bloodthirsty gods', and facilitate the passage of 'baptized children' from the cosmic order into the arms of Lilith, harvesting energy and knowledge for the practitioner.

Referred to as the 'Arachnid mother', 'mother of crib death', 'mother of abortion', and 'demonic feminine'. She is the recipient of aborted children, who become 'Lilin' in her arms. Lilith represents a balance of perfect unity with Samael, embodying the feminine aspect of the demonic and chaos, a 'faceless queen' who grants enlightenment and true sight through transgression.

An archangel identified as the accuser, seducer, and destroyer in Judaism, and often considered the true angelic name of Satan. His name means 'venom of God'. In this system, Samael is the 'father of Dissidence' and forms a 'perfect unity' with Lilith, representing the masculine aspect of the demonic and chaos. His offspring with Eve is Cain, considered the 'first murderer and thus the first Satanist'.

practical_system.description: The Aka Paimon system is a structured practical guide for initiating and advancing in Chao-Luciferianism. It integrates Kabbalistic gematria, sigil magic, meditation, and various forms of sacrifice to achieve internal transformation and alignment with anti-cosmic forces. The goal is to break free from the Demiurge's cosmic order, activate the inner 'black flame' (Ahrimanic spark), and facilitate a return to Sitra Ahra. The system emphasizes mastering the mind, embracing dissidence, and performing rituals in designated sacred spaces using specific tools to manipulate spiritual energies and achieve enlightenment and power.

Do what thou wilt, shall be the whole of the law.

But do not forget that your reality is not reality for the reality exists outside the egg, outside in the timeless, eternal, pan dimensional chaos. Ah, o return me to Sitra Ahra, o dark mother of desire!

The Black holes are the Nexion And for thousands of years we kept the flame fed

Those easily influenced should be deterred from this book, and those whom own it should not lend it to those of meak minds. Chao-Luciferianism is for the elevated, and the elite, not the botch and weak.

Many times in history, Satanism has been re-defined, and each time it has been a pale, and Hollywood-esque approach. Mindless materialism and heathenism have been re-packaged in Anton LaVay’s so called Chuch of Satan, however Mr. LaVay’s work is nothing more then a social and satirical commentary on modern times, and although comical and interesting. It has unfortunately been branded “Satanism”. LaVay forgot what it means to be in league with Satan.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book is a significant, albeit controversial, contribution to modern esoteric literature, specifically within anti-cosmic Luciferianism and Chaos Magic. It offers a unique synthesis of Qabalah (interpreted adversarially), Zoroastrian cosmology (Ahrimanic), and grimoire traditions, creating a distinct and coherent magical system. Its explicit rejection of mainstream 'Satanism' (particularly LaVeyan) and its detailed instructions for transgressive rituals (including human and child sacrifice, and abortion rituals) mark it as a radical text that pushes the boundaries of occult practice and ethics. The author's use of gematria and Temura to uncover hidden numerical and linguistic correspondences is central to the system's operative mechanics, demonstrating a deep engagement with occult numeracy.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is explicitly defined as 'the elevated, and the elite,' those who are 'tired of plastic occultism and the dominating religious cults of Tetragrammaton and Demiurge.' It is intended for serious practitioners of 'Chao-Luciferianism' who are committed to a path of radical self-empowerment, spiritual dissidence, and the complete abandonment of conventional morality. The author warns off those with 'meak minds,' 'weekend Satanists,' or anyone seeking merely 'dark and morbid curiosity,' emphasizing that the material is dangerous and requires a profound commitment to the anti-cosmic agenda and a willingness to engage in transgressive acts.
